metadata.title: CVE-2019-10162 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server beforeversions 4.1.10, 4.0.8 allowing an authorized user to cause the server toexit by inserting a crafted record in a MASTER type zone under theircontrol. The issue is due to the fact that the Authoritative Server willexit when it runs into a parsing error while looking up the NS/A/AAAArecords it is about to use for an outgoing notify.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-server - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-tools - 4.1.6-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.6-3build1').
